intro: Ptilotus schwartzii var. georgei, commonly known as the George's spinifex, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the Goodeniaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features slender, wiry stems and small, spiny leaves that help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom during the warmer months. Ptilotus schwartzii var. georgei is adapted to sandy soils and is often found in coastal dunes and inland shrublands.
